las.jl

The core of the package to read potrees made of las or laz files. The main difference with the load.jl of (marteseragh)[https://github.com/marteresagh] are stored in the las2pointcloud function.

multithreading on las2pointcloud

This function is crucial because it reads the coordinates and rgbs of each point and each file. The number of files in a potree grows as the potree size grows so if we have a potree with milions and milions of points the multithreading helps to reduce the computation time of the structure.

benchmarking

Using a small file (357.003 points):

! This potree is present in this package into potree folder

Using a big file (14.027.872 points):

! This potree is NOT present in this package into potree folder : download

As you can see even if the allocation is bigger the computational time is ~60% less.

Main Interface

Potree.las2pointcloud — Function
las2pointcloud(fnames::String...) -> PointCloud

Read more than one file .las and extrapolate the LAR model and the color of each point.

source
Potree.las2larpoints — Function
las2larpoints(file::String) -> Lar.Points

Return coordinates of points in LAS file.

source
Potree.las2aabb — Function
las2aabb(file::String) -> AABB

Return LAS file's bounding box.

source
Potree.las2color — Function
las2color(file::String)::Lar.Points

Return color, rgb, associated to each point in LAS file.

source
Potree.color — Function
color(p::LasPoint, header::LasHeader)

Return color of one point in LAS file.

source
Potree.xyz — Function
 xyz(p::LasPoint, h::LasHeader)

Return coords of this point p.

source
Potree.read_LAS_LAZ — Function
read_LAS_LAZ(fname::String)

Read point cloud files: LAS or LAZ.

source
